passage_text: Marquette University Description: Marquette University, located in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, is a private, Jesuit, Roman Catholic University. The university typically places well on rankings of national universities, and its programs in business, nursing and the biomedical sciences are worth a close look. Marquette University is a Catholic, Jesuit university dedicated to serving God by serving our students and contributing to the advancement of knowledge.

By the numbers — Class of 2019. Marquette students have a reputation for academic excellence and service to the community. We even look for those qualities in potential students. But we also want to learn more about your activities, your interests and your passions — the things that make you who you are

Average ACT Score: 28. At Marquette, 90% of students submitted their ACT scores for college application and the average admitted student's ACT score was around 28, which is considerably higher than the average score at other top tier private (not-for-profit) institutions. At Marquette, 16% of students submit their SAT scores for college application and the average admitted student's SAT score was around 1750, which is considerably higher than the average score at other top tier private (not-for-profit) institutions.

The average SAT score composite at Marquette University is a 1761. The 25th percentile SAT score is 1590, and the 75th percentile SAT score is 1910. In other words, a 1590 places you below average, while a 1910 will move you up to above average. There's no absolute SAT requirement at Marquette University, but they really want to see at least a 1590 to have a chance at being considered

Discussion of Marquette's Admissions Standards: Marquette University is a selective private Catholic university in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. Just over half of all applicants will get in, and students who are admitted tend to have grades and test scores that are above average. In the graph above, the blue and green dots represent accepted students.

Marquette University Admissions Statistics. There are three critical numbers when considering your admissions chances: ACT scores, GPA, and acceptance rate. All these combine to tell you what you scores are required to get into Marquette University. This school did not officially report its average GPA, but we've estimated it here using data from over 1,000 schools.). With a GPA of 3.65, Marquette University requires you to be above average in your high school class. You'll need a mix of A's and B's, with a leaning toward A's.

The average ACT score composite at Marquette University is a 27. The 25th percentile ACT score is 25, and the 75th percentile ACT score is 29. In other words, a 25 places you below average, while a 29 will move you up to above average. This school did not officially report its average GPA, but we've estimated it here using data from over 1,000 schools.). With a GPA of 3.65, Marquette University requires you to be above average in your high school class. You'll need a mix of A's and B's, with a leaning toward A's.

A SAT or ACT exam may be required before applying to this school. Scores in the range of 1590 (25th percentile) to 1910 (75th percentile) for the SAT exam and in the range of 25 (25th percentile) to 29 (75th percentile) for the ACT exam is common among applicants accepted to this school. Marquette University admits around 60% of students applying per year. Of those that are admitted, around 15% of students registered for enrollment. When applying historical data, we have projected that the Marquette University acceptance rate 2015 will be around 58%.

This is an admit rate an about in line with the average for all engineering schools (63.47%). Yield Rate. Marquette University has a yield rate of 15.51%, which means it is less likely for a student to accept an offer of admission from this school than the average engineering school (the average yield rate is 35.77%).
